div.div: Posted by Dee Leaman on 5/15/2017 11:00:00 PM

p.span: Central Dauphin School District's e-communications program helps to get timely communication from our schools out to the public. We feel e-Communications will provide a better way to reach out to our parents and students while reducing the amount of paper sent home. Some information may continue to come home in paper form. Copies of all information on the website will also be stored in school offices. However, we are looking to move the vast majority of the information that goes home to our web site.

We recognize that some parents do not have the opportunity to reliably use our web site on a regular basis. For those families, Central Dauphin will make paper copies of relevant flyers available to your child on a weekly basis. To get paper copies, you simply need to contact the school office. A packet of papers will be gathered each week for your child to pick up at the office. We thank you for your cooperation with this initiative.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for e-Communications Overview

span.p: Due to the government shutdown, the April 20, 2020 Board meeting must be held virtually. If you wish to speak at the meeting you must sign-up by emailing Kim Fisher at kfisher@cdschools.org by 5:00 p.m. on Monday, April 20, 2020. Please provide your name, mailing address, email address and topic of discussion. You will be provided log-in information and instructions for the virtual meeting. The meeting can be viewed by clicking on the following link: https://video.ibm.com/channel/AKuW6EveQWv If you wish to have your comments recognized during the second portion of Pubic Speakers for the April 20, 2020 Board meeting, you may email your comments to publiccomments@cdschools.org.

a.title: Go to comments for APRIL 20, 2020 SCHOOL BOARD MEETING

img.title: Free Grab & Go Meal Service - Extended Times
img.alt: Free Grab & Go Meal Service - Extended Times

li.span: CDSD Free Grab & Go Breakfast & Lunch Availability During District Wide Closure Due to COVID-19 Closure - We will continue the Grab & Go Meal Service at CD East High and Swatara Middle School, Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. – Noon through the remainder of the school year. Please watch for information regarding the Summer Meal Program.

SHEETZ Expands Meal Program to Over 600 Stores (updated April 17, 2020) - The Sheetz Kidz Meal Bagz program providing free food to help children and families in need as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic will be available at all 600 locations all day starting Thursday, April 16. The meal will include a turkey sandwich, chips and a drink. Families interested in taking advantage of the free Kidz Meal Bagz program should go to participating Sheetz locations and ask an employee at the register for a meal. Families will be offered one bag per child and meals will be available daily while supplies last. For more information visit https://www.sheetz.com/news/kidzmeals
Nutripacks Website - We will be temporarily suspending our distribution until further notice. Click HERE for further information.

a.title: Go to comments for MEAL INFORMATION & RESOURCES

span.span: Students, Family, Community, COVID19 and Staff Links

strong.span: PA SCHOOLS WILL REMAIN CLOSED THROUGH END OF SCHOOL YEAR

span.span: The CDSD was notified that all PA School Districts will remained closed through the end of the school year.

a.strong: Comcast Internet Essentials Speed Increase/60 Days Free For New Customers

li.span: Comcast announced that they will increase the speeds of their Internet Essentials service (from 15/2 MB to 25/3 MB) and offer the service free of charge for 60 days for new Internet Essentials customers. Select the title link for more information, go to www.internetessentials.com, call 1-855-846-8376 or click HERE. New customers will get a free and easy to use self-install kit by mail. Current customers don't need to do anything to get the speed increases.

p.span: During the school closure, registrations will be processed electronically. Email cdsdregistration@cdschools.org to register your student. Please provide your name, the student’s name, and a phone number to reach you. After you email the address above, a Central Registration staff member will contact you within the next 3 business days to begin the registration process.

a.title: Go to comments for NEW STUDENT REGISTRATION

span.p: Teacher Access Center (TAC) and Home Access Center (HAC) will be unavailable on Sunday, April 19th from 11:00 PM until Monday April 20th at 7:00 AM for scheduled maintenance.
